bow: moms who had very difficult babies and made it to the other side please tell me it gets better need some positivity today you name it ve been through it with my baby reflux pyloric stenosis milk protein allergy neediness all day every day now he been inconsolably crying at least once day almost every day for the last months because of what thought was teething but there still no sign of tooth and every doctor just tells me that some babies are like this and he ll grow out of it ca stop worrying that he in pain or that things will never change anybody with an extremely fussy baby did they grow into pleasant child my son was like this he cried nonstop for his first year of life pretty much he always needed to be held he had silent reflux and ulcers from it it was really bad we got him on zantac and it cut the crying down by like it was amazing then we got his tongue tie fixed and that helped little more too he would only really cry ton while teething now he and he is big old whiner but it is like it was before he plays by himself never thought he ever would he feeds himself he spends most of the day without me having to console him it huge and it feels good not only for me but imagine what it must be like for him his tummy hurt really bad for long time and it took me forever to figure it out saw the tongue tie myself and went to like doctors about black poop aka digested blood before someone did something about it felt like the worst mom ever but did what could if you feel like something is wrong take him to another doctor do be polite for the sake of being polite be mean if you have to if they brush you off say no you need to look into this wish have been more strong in the face of doctors when all of them told me he was fine and it was til he was like months old that gastroenterologist told me his reflux was extremely severe and damaging his stomach but anyway long story short he is good now so it does get better just hang in there and get as much help as you can and another thing to add is that just had my 2nd and she hardly cries at all hugs my firstborn was preemie and nightmare baby he was the first grandbaby on one side only the second on the other and the first boy in the family and no one wanted to watch him he had horrible colic and stomach problems screamed all the time never slept and was just puddle of drool while he teethed now he about to turn five and is one of the most easygoing kids on the planet he the kid you can take to the movies or restaurant without worrying about how he ll act he an awesome big brother he clever funny and sweet it makes me nervous in way because my second the month old is ridiculously easy baby hoping he wo reverse on me too my son was pain he was weeks early and did eat much at single setting so we had to wake him up every two hours to eat at three months he decided colic would be good idea and cried endlessly for months that was about the time he got bacaterial pneumonia and was miserable for another month now he is 11 and pretty great kid he has the typical rolling of the eyes or slamming of the door but over all he is kind and quiet and lets me not only sleep all night but he sleeps in later than do on the weekends it gets so much better thanks so much for your reply that the thing about the reflux zantac did help at all do know how much the prilosec has helped with the discomfort but the spit up has come down notch since we switched so wo mess with it and about the black poop call his ped all the time about poop color and consistency it been super dark forest green since switching formulas to neocate and he always either constipated or has liquid stool no one seems to be concerned even though ve showed them just how close to black colored it is we ve seen maybe different doctors at this practice and they re part of the best hospital in the country network so convinced every time that the problem is in how handling it as the crazy first time mom that am and would know where else to go for second opinion switched gi specialists because the last one totally lacked any kind of bedside manners barely took down our extensive history had to remind him of really important clues that he did seem to think were important and sent us on our way with more zantac even after told him it was working then come to find out week later that there was blood in his stool found at routine visit at his primary ped and she diagnosed milk protein allergy then at months was like so my baby has to be bleeding internally for anybody to listen to me ve not been polite ever since so can totally relate to feeling like the worst mom on the planet even though keep trucking along and calling crying demanding to be seen and taken seriously only to be placated and patronized until the shit really hits the fan oh sorry rambling there just so much to say and no where to start just thanks quick question this is the first ve heard about ulcers how did they test for that we ve had an ultrasound xrays and an upper gi but no one has mentioned to check for ulcers always joke that my son got my personality he had colic and milk protein allergy literally would spend hours walking around the neighborhood or bouncing on yoga ball with screaming baby strapped to my chest it changed around months he is still difficult child he is stubborn and strong willed but once the crying stops your nerves can handle so much more although challenging can appreciate the qualities of his personality that will serve him well later in life aww thanks so much that does make me feel better part of me thinks need to have another baby because ve barely been able to fully enjoy this one the way thought would used to love babies but wondering if it just my luck and the next one would be even harder but we shall see thanks again do have as long of list as you do but the first few weeks my son was fussy got fussier as the day went on it was problem with dairy in my diet he later went through few very attached periods and it was extremely helpful to find babywearing otherwise never would have gotten anything done would highly recommend finding local babywearing group and try it out right now he is happy increasingly independent almost two year old who can entertain himself and rarely cries even in his rough explorations it is so hard to have crying child and not being able to do anything about it hope it passes quickly and you have the help you need good luck thank you was afraid of babywearing because he used to spit up vomit constantly so instead ve just held him on the couch for the majority of the last months or we would take walk in his stroller and yes it impossible to get anything done 90 of the day now that the spit up has decreased bit ve been seriously thinking about splurging on new carrier yup it the crying that pushes me right off the edge thank you how old my twins are now one of them was an easy baby one had reflux and cried for real all the time wore her in an ergo constantly and just stood up all the time swaying back and forth it was awful she had period where she would eat unless she was half asleep too that was fun probably around eight months she grew out of it now she is *awesome* she is the best calmest sweetest kid ever she can entertain herself she perfect unfortunately the easy twin baby is total pain in the ass now willful oppositional whiny just brat and naturally it not problem with anyone but *me* she behaves well at preschool for the most part so here hoping your difficult baby grows into an easy toddler thank you hoping you re right edit misspelling mine was nightmare spent my entire life waiting to be mom and then nope nevermind made mistake mine screamed round the clock for year and was pretty miserable for two years when he was 12 months ish found the schedule of night time wake ups and feeding did every two hours broke down sobbing because year later nothing had changed was suicidal for the first and only time in my life we tried zantac around months and thought it did work it was until 12 months when another doctor suggested we give him the maximum possible dosage are you doing that now mine is adore him want to spend every minute with him every day after got better and every day after has been awesome plus spent so long being so miserable that now little phases of disruption that drive other parents batty seem like nothing to me good luck you will reach that happy place eventually do everything for yourself you can to help you get there in one piece it gets better mine was dread beast for months reflux and mspi and fought sleep like champion thought it would never end and indeed it felt like forever until all that stopped now have happy smiling charming though incredibly bossy year old and oh man it feels good to not have to deal with that anymore good luck you can do this and it will end soon yup mine fights sleep all the time too ugh thank you this makes me so sad for you and me lol but can totally relate thought my **pregnancy** was really hard was fighting depression before he even got here but kept telling myself it would all be worth it but it all just got soooo much harder just hope we re that lucky to come out of this with healthy happy kid my biggest fear is that all of this is an indicator for an even bigger problem that he ll have to deal with his whole life that been the hardest for me to deal with but regular sleep would be nice too so happy you re in better place thanks for your story my oldest had reflux issues and colic from the get go to about year it was awful and was completely alone as had just moved across the country from my family and her dad was deployed most of the time actually surprised got through it mostly sane and even managed to agree to another one before she was even my middle child was breeze rarely cried and loved being held my year old was also breeze and still is even now the other two are starting that preteen phase which seems harder than even the colic sometimes my daughter was my difficult one after difficult birth she turned out to be very demanding baby just as was healing from my section she decides to give colic go we battled that for about months then it all changed when she was about months old she was much easier baby after that she even started sleeping through the night as that point she now and while she is strong willed and stubborn she still really good kid my son is 15 months now and he much more laid back child than my daughter he never had colic and he slept through the night by about months so you will get through this with your first and any other kids you have wo necessarily be as difficult hang in there deleted preemie twin mom son who has an autoimmune disease the other had colic and an epigastric hernia plus both have had at least surgeries the son the ai disease was yo and 19 lbs disordered eating that required team of experts living hell for the past years just seeing the light bless you it will happen had one of those he did sleep through the night reguarly until he was almost honestly resented him and did really like him much for awhile the thing is he brilliant in kindergarten he reading harry potter and doing his brother 2nd grade math homework faster than he can my older is very good at math btw anyway some kids brains seem to move faster than they develop if that makes sense he was just always super frustrated and got really irritated when he was over or under stimulated he kick ass kid now and totally fun to be with but birth to were not very fun years for me we made it out of those dark times and we re really really close now utterly adore being with him now instead of constantly hiding from him and wishing he *juststopscreaming* you ll make it too why do they fight sleep my girl just thinks sleep is the worst while my daughter did have any of the problems you listed she was the most difficult baby for the first or 10 months of her life nursing was struggle because of an upper lip tie she did ever want to be put down could leave her with sitter and until was forced to stop nursing at months she refused bottle from me or anyone else my husband and were pulling our hair out wondering what we got ourselves into after that she gradually got easier to handle she went through the terrible twos and threes but she is the most chill year old you ll ever meet loving sweet funny smart chatty just the type of kid hoped she would become when we were in the throes of difficult infanthood hang in there promise it does get easier yes my baby had reflux latching issues could produce milk properly and she did sleep through the night for the first time until she was nearly she now and she *such an awesome kid not going to tell you everything is perfect but the good days far outnumber the bad and we re actually considering having another now the girl is smart funny and so incredibly sweet not day goes by without dozens of hugs kisses cuddles and love you it gets better my first had terrible colic that the diagnosis they gave me which felt like well we do know he seems healthy so colic there were days would put him in his crib crying and would lay on his floor and cry too he now he the most gentle kind soul seriously the sweetest little boy who is always so concerned with me being happy hang in there he going through some stuff and it hard for him but it gets better oh am here for you second kid colicky dairy intolerant terrible sleeper he screamed non stop for months it seemed it was in reality but it so feels that way oh and he has asthma resolving now and had febrile seizures he had er trips before he was he now and the funniest sweetest kid ever super chill slept well after bit of sleep training was resistent because of space issues and room sharing but it went fine he can now eat small amounts of dairy and is seriously happy kid it got ton bettter after he turned but colic is bad my ped said that needed all the help could get and to be aware of my own anger and triggers because its so frustrating pm me anytime you need to vent colicky kids can be isolating because all those other babies are all snuggly and yours is just screaming wore him in the beco for months oh man that was my kid could stand still for months because was so used to rocking him that even when was holding him was moving my daughter had colic it was awful at some point realized that there was anything could do but be there with her simply being present and walking that path with her was my role bought earplugs so that could hold her while she cried that helped lot today is very happy independent year old who is joy to be around and is great sleeper hang in there right now it feels like it will never end but promise soon you ll look back on it like it was all dream while you play with you sweet kiddo my daughter had reflux and milk protein allergies as well and it was constant crying day and night even though we changed her formula and everything oatmeal helped it helped with the reflux and helped with the tummy problems she still cried lot but she was much much happier baby put oatmeal in every bottle she had it was the consistency of thin paste she is now over year and only cries when teething you will know if they are teething because there will be swelling of the gums and it will be bump where the tooth is going to come in it does get better it just finding out what works for your baby do get discouraged they are in pain and ca tell you what wrong it frustrating but they love you and need you you are their world and they want the pain to stop just as much as you do my daughter is delight and laughs and giggles and plays and is extremely happy you can do it have an 11 month old who is still doing this she was sick when she was born and is just fussy and needy 24 there are times where get extremely emotional and feel like it will never end but it will she the youngest of and my oldest was the same way he grew out of it shortly after and has not had needy issues since then it hard though because have needy year old already who is jealous and jealous year old as well honestly though the age gap would make things easier but nope it easiest with my son who is 12 and self sufficient my little guy was total velcro baby he would scream like he was being murdered if mommy was holding him in exactly the right way every minute of the day and woke up every 20 30 minutes at night full on screaming we called him guantanamo baby he is still not the easiest toddler and does play on his own lot but he is so much easier he loves other people now is so funny and charming people adore him he has leadership qualities taught him baby sign language by using the baby signing time dvd and he learned to talk really early and communication has helped immensely wish had taken better care of myself during that ridiculously hard first year maybe forced daddy to learn to sooth him or something now they are best friends still do get lot of sleep but my body is little bit adjusted have so much fun with my little guy now he is really friendly and talks to everyone hang in there know it hard and probably no one understands but velcobabies met few moms who had had tough one any other moms just did understand and thought was doing something wrong stay away from judgemental people for your own sanity they re so cute when they sleep that makes me smile after long day of baby tending my son poop was like black like charcoal it was unmistakable ve read that forest green poop is caused by iron supplements in formula that has happened with my daughter who is mostly breastfed but gets supplementation with formula sometimes as for the ulcers the doctor suspected them because of the black poop he said we could do an endoscope kinda test to look but only if the black poop persisted after we tried the zantac it did and do know if needed that test done either it seems really traumatic and or did want any heavy sedation to happen with my little guy unless it was absolutely necessary glad you re not letting anyone just brush off your concerns it so hard as mom to feel like you re crazy because you re worried about your baby and no one is listening ugh hope you can get some help with your baby boy used to lay awake at night frustrated at myself for being so short fused with my crying baby knowing that he was crying because he was in pain worst feeling ever my son was extremely fussy had trouble talking to friends about kids because their worst days usually sounded easier than my best days and just did know how to respond it was hard to be sympathetic and learned to leave the room when the topic of sleep came up because any time heard how other people babies were sleeping would get angry and resentful anyway for us things got lot better around 13 months part of that was night weaning we did do cry it out but there was ton of crying involved but think more than anything was that was when he began talking as he learned to communicate with us and understand what we were telling him things got better and better really think that communication was nearly all of the change and it made huge difference by 15 months finally had the feeling of love my kid so much going to explode that had never had before and then by 18 months started having that feeling daily always loved him but it was so hard remember when people asked me but it all worth it right my usual response had been not really not right now but do believe that it will be worth it someday also started having the feeling of this is what signed up for still believe had pretty realistic expectations of motherhood but that first year was brutal ll say that 18 months to were really great and as year old he was probably easier than most year olds now at almost ll say he is still different kind of kid not your typical boy or your typical year old he is hard in ways that other kids are typically easy and easy in ways that other kids are typically hard but do mind so much anymore understand him better and feel more fulfilled at having the job of helping him negotiate his way in the world with his unique characteristics he awesome with constantly crying baby there just is very much fulfillment it is lot of rewardless work ll also say that still constantly hear people say oh the first year is when they are easy bullshit have two kids now and pregnant with 3rd never never have things been even close to as hard as that first year with fussy baby it will get better hang in there my daughter had ear infections that were pushed off as teething for while not sure if they checked tour little one out but say have someone look in those ears just in case also it gets so much easier as they get older did have all the problems you had but my daughter has really bad allergies and had ear infections consistently that resulted in needing tubes and after the initial infant time it gets so much easier even if the problems stay with them they seem to be able to cope easier hang in there mama it gets better my son has gerd erosive esophagitis and mspi it was crazy the first four months of his life just turned six months last week if he was awake he was crying what finally made huge difference was prilosec zantac never did anything he on the max dose of prilosec and it has been magical when he pukes now it like nothing ever happened where as he used to have extreme pain afterwards when he was on zantac he is literally the happiest baby these days people comment how he so sweet and good baby all the time reflux is also supposed to peak at four months unfortunately not true for us so you may be just on the cusp of things getting easier also like others suggested if you can try to get his dose upped on the prilosec could make huge difference if you re getting the prilosec compounded make sure you are getting it refilled every two weeks after two weeks the stuff they buffer it with starts to break it down and it loses it potency fast hang in there swear it does get better wow that sounds exactly what ve been through with my son first it was reflux then pyloric stenosis then milk protein allergy and teething if he still crying lot take him to his gi doctor and ask about food allergies my son is almost one now and we re having to get full allergy testing done and an endoscopy with the endoscopy they re looking for disease called eoe does your son have rash on his face if he does food allergy can cause the whole body to itch which would make anyone fussy also it does get better promise even though my son still has lot going on he doing better and sleeping please pm me if you would like think you re the first person that ve heard the exact same story from that really sucks no one would watch him for you to get break when you needed it most do think could survive without my parents giving me one night off week to be regular human being going to show my husband this thread maybe that will offput him wanting second child for while am so glad you posted this going through the same thing with my four month old doctors said as long as he alive and gaining weight not to worry about the all day screamfest what about quality of life and sanity oh my god yes every single one of the last 20+ sick visits they ve told me how beautiful the growth chart looks shrug at all his symptoms and send me on my way just yesterday went in and they told me the same thing ve finally decided to go get second opinion and already sad it took me this long hang in there that so crazy ve looked everywhere and have found anyone with the same story so glad you found me went to his doctor and asked about an endoscopy he said that it not emergent and he does want to put the baby through it so now feel bad for wanting it either way have an appt with new gi doctor in the middle of may and ll ask them about it he does get rashes almost ever but he is on neocate over the counter hypoallergenic formulas once we discovered the blood in his stool still made him vomit guessing because it took so long and by then there was already too much damage done internally for his stomach to handle anything ugh the guilt ll definitely keep in touch us moms of one of kind now of kind babies have to stick together and good luck with the endoscopy let me know how that goes my son is also on neocate also thought of something has your son gotten sick lot was wondering because ear infection can make them cry lot do feel bad about asking for an endoscopy ask again when you see the new gi ll pm you soon hey sorry it taking me forever to respond these days it sounds like you ve had your hands full too can ask what testing was done to get your diagnoses wondering because we ve had think everything except for the endoscopy and ve been to the office with my concerns at the bare minimum 20 times and all they ever say is reflux my instincts are telling me there got to be something majorly wrong with his esophagus because this is nothing like what ve heard typical reflux is but doctors at our pediatrician practice have told me again and again that it is plus the er staff and the gi wing at chop getting second opinion on monday to see if they agree with that diagnosis but wondering if should press them for more specific testing another thing thank you for the tip on the prilosec no one ever mentioned that before either beginning to feel like our medical treatment has been joke if by sick you mean vomiting then yes but as far as colds or fevers never do feel bad about asking for endoscopy at all if that the answer to all of our questions in fact right after responded to your first message called another reputable hospital nearby and they had an opening with specialist for this upcoming monday it takes me month to schedule an appt through our first network so this is pretty unbelievable and already mad at myself for waiting so long to call hopefully we start getting to the bottom of things ve been looking into eoe and it does sound pretty spot on except my baby has never failed to grow am hoping it not the case but much rather know exactly what going on than fearing the unknown thanks yup could ve written those last two sentences it nightmare thank you sorry he just turned months this made me feel better thank you just more years oh^my^god lol thanks thank you hope you re right heyyy it your cake day wish could give you more upvotes thanks guess can wait another years thank you really need all the help in the world right now and my husband and are feeling so isolated his family is hours away and seemingly unaware of the extent of his issues and let just say my family is not the best of help half tempted to look into nanny or something we really ca afford because this is truly the hardest thing ve ever done ca imagine having another kid at this point it scary to think about ohhh god bless you so sorry you ve been through so much more than could imagine hope you have had ton of help and support and that things keep getting so much better now you and your babes deserve it take care lt no problem if my colicky kid was my first would never have had second hired mothers helper much cheaper per hour it was most helpful in the early evening when my tensions were highest my dad and in laws avoided us people are freaked out by colic they want sweet babies seriously pm anytime do you mind telling me what the max dose of prilosec is my son is on itand fairly certain the does is to low he projectiles often and hates it when he does it also comes out hoods nose and it painful it gotten beret on prilosec but do think it enough he on the 2mg kit suspension and he taking cc day we skipped zantac because the emergency pediatrician he saw right after we brought my son home from the nicu is professor of pediatrics and he said zantac almost never works the prilosec worked wonders alex only cries if he wants something is sick throws up or refluxes out his nose btw my son has nasty reflux accompanied by consistent projectile vomiting pretty sure he has lip tie ill be talking to his pediatrician about he also might have milk allergy wow and somehow managed not to notice until it was over it also my birthday today and somehow had realized that joined reddit on my birthday either oh gosh the mouth and nose is so horribly painful remember my lo would just meltdown when that happened anyway dosage is based on weight so do not know what the max would be for your lo my lo has been on 3ml 3cc twice day since he was four months he big though 18 pounds and over 28 inches at months the dose is still very effective even with him puking ton he happy baby and he never cries when he spits up anymore aww well happy birthday sorry if this is long and or rambly feel your pain so thought was going to have complete breakdown before we got all his issues under control we finally got into gi when he was months she confirmed the gerd and she said she could tell by the sound of his cry and quick look at his throat that he had esophagitis while your lo may not have it sure there still lot of pain due to the reflux we had to see other pediatricians before we found one who was dismissive about his spitting up she referred us to the gi the other doctors would simply repeat all babies spit up he not losing weight so he fine it seems lot of pediatrician think reflux is bs we were so lucky our current pediatrician had daughter just like him gerd and mspi his pediatrician diagnosed the mspi by blood in his stool not to mention projectile vomiting and constant diaper blowouts due to diarrhea which as first time parents we did know it was diarrhea we thought he just pooped lot he been doing great on alimentum since he was weeks no more projectile pukes oh and as an fyi his vomiting was is so bad he was checked for pyloris twice we had problems with prilosec too until the gi told us about the drug deteriorating quickly when compounded our pediatrician did tell us about that so we were refilling once month it was almost comical when we told the gi it would seem to work for while and then stop she promptly made the connection to not refilling the rx every two weeks as benchmark for you he taking 3mls of 2mg per ml compound twice day he ~18lbs and slightly over 28 inches at months seriously though he is so different now he happy 90 of the time now instead of the opposite he sleeps incredibly well at night instead of waking up every hr screaming he sleeps from 7pm till around 6am every night without waking up no sleep training necessary here hoping your second opinion goes well monday hopefully you ll get some help figuring out what going on ve found the site reflux rebels very informative that amazing thank you my son has an appointment in few days and think going to ask if we can increase it he about six pounds and was almost 19 inches at his last appointment he almost two months old so do know what his max will be but maybe that will help my daughter is 18months they suspected pyloric stenosis reflux always wants to be held cranky it was so very difficult coupled with me having retained placenta the first three months were the most difficult the reflux got better month introduced solids around 5m and it changed she is an angel life seems normal now still hectic with child but nothing like first few months hang in there good times are coming
